name: ITP - 140 - Exposed Aggregate Footpath
template name: ITP - 140 - Exposed Aggregate Footpath Rev A

name: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Methodology and ITP to be submitted to the Engineer and approved prior to works beginning
Frequency - Submit 10 days prior to commencement of works
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Survey Set out as per contract drawings and specification, capturing pre-construction levels where needed.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete the Excavation permit process to identify, locate and protect all services.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Complete internal Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Hot works, concrete saw, lift, confined space, working at height etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Obtain External Permits as required to complete works including but not limited to: Close approach, Worksafe Notice etc.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Prior to starting works, Ensure that the construction drawings are both IFC and the Current Version.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Review previously completed workpacks to ensure work completed meets the contract requirements
SECTION 4 – MATERIAL, PERSONNEL & THIRD PARTY APPROVAL
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Record material type used and source testing of that material
Frequency - 1 source test per material type
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Record material type used and source testing of that material
Frequency - 1 source test per material type

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All uniaxial, biaxial and triaxial geogrid shall be manufactured in accordance with a management system that complies with BS EN ISO 9001 and BS 14001 and shall submit to the Engineer for approval.
Frequency - At least two weeks prior to works.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Exposed aggregate panels shall be Firth Designer Concrete with the following mixes:
○ Feature Pattern Mix A: Firth ‘Golden Harvest’ pebble mix with 4kg per m3 Carbon Black oxide (OXCDFR)
○ Feature Pattern Mix B: Firth ‘Waipa’ pebble mix with Choco 0704063 Peter Fell Oxide 10% dose
○ Secondary Path and Street Furniture Base Mix: Firth ‘Half Black’ with 2kg per m3 of Carbon Black oxide (OXCDFR)
○ All concrete pedestrian and cycle paths to have a 5% full dose of black iron oxide dose added to the mix.
Standard / Specification - App C - PWD Landscape Spec Tender V2 8.04 - Section 6.3
Frequency - 1 x data sheet per material type & Cocnrete dockets every truck load
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Water-based retarder to be approved by BBO
Standard / Specification - App C - PWD Landscape Spec Tender V2 8.04 - Section 6.4
Frequency - 1 x data sheet per material type
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - After set-out and prior to installation of footpaths

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The exposed subgrade (excavated to trial subgrade level or pavement depth) shall be tested by using a Scala Penetrometer for compliance with a CBR value >10 (4 blows per 100mm). For subgrade of CBR value <10 (4 blows per 100mm), refer to 5.01.3.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Subgrade CBR <10 but > 7 (3 blows per 100mm) 75mm GAP20, CBR <7 (2 blows per 100mm) 100mm undercut & 175mm GAP20, CBR < 3 100mm Undercut, grid (standard biaxial or triaxial equivalent) & 175mm GAP20.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Geogrid to be placed flat on subgrade. For areas that require lapping, lapping to be 500mm.
5.01.5 - Subgrade Backfill Fill Compaction Testing - Aggregate Subgrade
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Aggregate Subgrade Fill shall be compacted to Clegg Impact Value (CIV) 10 for footpaths upto 3m wide, and CIV20 for footpath greater than 3m wide.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - (For CBR > 10% or 4 blows per 100mm) - Bedding Sand to be replaced at a consistent thickness of 75mm free of foreign materials, bedding surface must be level and free of any peaks or troughs
5.01.7 - Site Preperation for Exposed Aggregate Work

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All surrounding finished surfaces shall be protected from any damage, spillage or splashes resulting from exposed aggregate works. Care shall be taken at all stages of construction to ensure runoff does not enter garden bed areas or waterways.
Standard / Specification - App C - PWD Landscape Spec Tender V2 8.04 - Section 6.4

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall give due notice to the Engineer of the time it is intended to place any concrete and no concrete shall be placed until approval has been obtained from the Engineer.
Verifying Document - Hold Point Release, Pre-Pour Check

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Immediately before placing the concrete, the foundations shall be lightly dampened, and formwork shall be cleaned out. In all cases surplus water shall be removed before concrete is placed. Any foreign or organic material hall be cleaned out.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Concrete shall not be placed on frozen ground nor shall it be placed in unfavourable conditions, which may be detrimental to the quality and finish of the concrete (i.e rainfall)

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Immediately after placement, concrete shall be protected from premature drying, excessively high or low temperatures and mechanical damage and shall be maintained with minimal moisture loss for the necessary curing period and hardening of the concrete. In hot dry weather sprinklers or damp covers will need to be used.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Concrete to meet a placed 28-day compressive strength of 20-Mpa

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Contraction/Expansion joints shall be formed or cut along the kerb at a maximum spacing of 3.0m. The slot shall penetrate the concrete by not less than 50mm and the mortar dressed over the cut face. The contractor shall ensure that cold joints are accurately marked and setout via total station so that the subsequent saw cut is in the cold joint. Should cracking occur adjacent to the saw cut a minimum section of 1.5 metres of the footpath shall be removed and re-cast. For reinforced Concrete, Cuts to be 30mm depth to avoid contact with steel reinforcing.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Backfilling against the poured footpath shall take place as soon as practicable after the concrete has reached sufficient strength, with particular emphasis at curves, corners, intersections and pedestrian kerb crossings but not prior to 36 hours after pouring.
Frequency - Not prior to 36 hours after pouring

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - All final path and vehicle crossing surfaces shall be true to the lines and levels. The final surface shall not vary by more than 5mm when checked with a 3m straight edge. No finished surface shall hold water.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Contractor shall construct a sample panel of three mixes with specified finishes for final approval by the Engineer, with a minimum size of 2.0m². Before construction, a meeting with the Engineer is required to confirm the sample preparation method. Once the sample is approved as representative of the specified colour and finish, it will set the standard for the work.
Standard / Specification - App C - PWD Landscape Spec Tender V2 8.04 - Section 6.5
Verifying Document - Correspondence with attached photos
Frequency - Once (Before commencing exposed aggregate foopaths)

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - After the concrete pour, an approved retardant shall be applied, using water-based retarders if dry conditions limit aggregate exposure time. The finish will be formed with a wash-off method on a prepared base. The Contractor shall screed and bullfloat the surface to level, ensuring even paste coverage. Aggregates must be fully embedded by tamping and working the surface with wood floats. Aggregate exposure starts when the surface supports the placer's weight without leaving a deeper impression than 2mm. The surface will then be sprayed and brushed with a medium-bristle broom to expose aggregates to a depth of 2-3mm
Standard / Specification - App C - PWD Landscape Spec Tender V2 8.04 - Section 6.4

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - After exposure the surface shall be cured by covering with plastic sheeting for a minimum of 3 days (7 days is preferable). An acid-wash treatment shall then be used to remove fine cement from the surface of the aggregate
Standard / Specification - App C - PWD Landscape Spec Tender V2 8.04 - Section 6.4
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - At 28 days, all concrete shall be sealed with two coats of Hydropel in accordance with themanufacturer’s instructions.
Standard / Specification - App C - PWD Landscape Spec Tender V2 8.04 - Section 6.4

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - On completion the contractor shall clean down all exposed finished work, remove all stains and discolorations and remedy any defects and scratches to the satisfaction of the Engineer
Standard / Specification - App C - PWD Landscape Spec Tender V2 8.04 - Section 6.4
SECTION 6 – POST CONSTRUCTION (FINAL INSPECTION AND HANDOVER)

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Compile construction records for final submission ensuring defects (NCRs) / Snags / missing records are captured or closed out, all tests have been received and passed, and changes / omissions have been noted.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Ensure all items have been surveyed and records are assembled for asbuilting

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Create a set of Redline Drawings for Asbuilt creation noting all changes and departures in red pen. Red line to show any changes to footpath location or basecourse depth.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Update the project Defect, Snag and Punch List Register
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.
